page.title: 01REVIEW OF MAP BLOCK
page.content: This 4km by 3km block is to be found in mid-west Durham skirting the villages of Sacriston (to the east), Edmondsley (north east) and Witton Gilbert (south east). It consists mainly of farmland, with some woodland, a little mining and quarrying. The main occupation is farming and the following nineteen pages reflect this dominance. The main area of settlement is the residential area of Witton Gilbert and the articles on "Home Life" are take based upon people living in this village. Although the mid-Durham area is generally considered to be largely "working class", the section of Witton Gilbert included in the block houses "professional" people and thus the typical weekends may not seem anachronistic.
